sen.j: 主税寮(しゅぜいりょう)は律令制において民部省に属した機関。
sen.e: Shuzeiryo refers to an institution belonging to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
Shuzeiryo refers to an institution that belonged to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
Shuzeiryo refers to an institution that belonged to Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 和訓は「ちからのつかさ」。
sen.e: This was called 'Chikara no Tsukasa' in a Japanese way.
This was called 'Chikara no Tsukasa' in a Japanese way.
This was called 'Chikara no Tsukasa' in a Japanese way.

sen.j: 養老律令によれば、主な職務は「倉廩（倉庫）の出納、諸国の田租、舂米（律令財政運用の基本単位である白米）、碾磑（水車で動かす臼）の事」と記されている。
sen.e: The Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) described that its major duties were 'taking out of and putting in a storage, denso (rice field tax) of various provinces, 春米 (white rice which was the base unit in the fiscal administration under the Ritsuryo system), and tengai (mill powered by the water).'
sen.cmt: 春米[読み方が不明でしたので、そのまま記載しました]
sen.e: The Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) described that its major duties were 'taking out of and putting in a storage, denso (rice field tax) of various provinces, shomai (white rice which was the base unit in the fiscal administration under the Ritsuryo system), and tengai (mill powered by the water).'

The Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) described that its major duties were 'taking out of and putting in a storage, denso (rice field tax) of various provinces, shomai (white rice which was the base unit in the fiscal administration under the Ritsuryo system), and tengai (mill powered by the water).'

sen.j: 主税寮は主計寮が調の税収監査を行って中央財政を管轄するのに対し､租税(特に租)や出挙の帳簿との照合などによる監査を通じて地方財政を管轄した。
sen.e: While Shukeiryo (Account Office) controlled the Central Finance by auditing the tax yields of cho (tributes), Shuzeiryo controlled local finance through auditing by verifying account books of land taxes (especially rice tax) and suiko (government loans made to peasants).

While Shukeiryo (Bureau of Statistics) controlled the Central Finance by auditing the tax yields of cho (tributes), Shuzeiryo controlled local finance through auditing by verifying account books of land taxes (especially rice tax) and suiko (government loans made to peasants).

While Shukeiryo (Bureau of Statistics) controlled the Central Finance by auditing the tax yields of cho (tributes), Shuzeiryo controlled local finance through auditing by verifying account books of land taxes (especially rice tax) and suiko (government loans made to peasants).

sen.j: そのため律令制崩壊後も長く存続した。
sen.e: Therefore, Shuzeiryo existed for a long time even after the collapse of Ritsuryo system.
Therefore, Shuzeiryo existed for a long time even after the collapse of Ritsuryo system.
Therefore, Shuzeiryo existed for a long time even after the collapse of Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 数学知識が必要となるため､頭か助は必ず算博士が兼ねるなど大学寮の算道出身者が活躍した。
sen.e: Since knowledge of mathematics was required, persons from Sando (study of mathematics) of Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system) played active roles like Sanhakase (Doctor of Numbers) concurrently took a position as Kami (Director) or Suke (Deputy Director).

Since knowledge of mathematics was required, persons from Sando (study of mathematics) of Daigakuryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system) played active roles like Sanhakase (Doctor of Numbers) concurrently took a position as Kami (Director) or Suke (Deputy Director).

Since knowledge of mathematics was required, persons from Sando (study of mathematics) of Daigakuryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system) played active roles like Sanhakase (Doctor of Numbers) concurrently took a position as Kami (Director) or Suke (Deputy Director).

sen.j: 主税寮の名称は現在､財務省 (日本)財務省主税局に継承されている。
sen.e: The name of Shuzeiryo has been succeeded by Shuzeikyoku (Taxation Bureau) of the Ministry of Finance (Japan).
sen.cmt: 財務省（日本）財務省主税局→Shuzeikyoku (Taxation Bureau) of the Ministry of Finance (Japan)[”財務省”が重複していると解釈し、”（日本）財務省主税局”として英訳しました]
sen.e: The name of Shuzeiryo has been succeeded by Shuzeikyoku (Taxation Bureau) of the Ministry of Finance (Japan).
The name of Shuzeiryo has been succeeded by Shuzeikyoku (Taxation Bureau) of the Ministry of Finance (Japan).

sen.j: 大允（正七位下） 少允（従七位上）
sen.e: Daijo (Senior Secretary) (Jurokuishoshichii (Junior Sixth Rank, Senior Seventh Grade)), and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (Jurokuijushichii (Junior Sixth Rank, Junior Seventh Grade))
Daijo (Senior Secretary) (Shoshichiinoge [Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade]), and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (Jushichiinojo [Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade])
sen.cmt: 「従六位正七位」「従六位従七位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正七位下」「従七位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Daijo (Senior Secretary) (Shoshichiinoge [Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade]), and Shojo (Junior Secretary) (Jushichiinojo [Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade])

sen.j: 大属（従八位上相当） 少属（従八位下相当）
sen.e: Daisakan (Senior Clerk) (Jurokuijuhachii (Junior Sixth Rank, Junior Eighth Grade)), and Shozakan (Junior Clerk) (Jurokuijuhachii (Junior Sixth Rank, Junior Eighth Grade))

sen.e: Daisakan (Senior Clerk) (Juhachiinojo [Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]), and Shosakan (Junior Clerk) (Juhachiinoge [Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade])
